intro: Pavetta dalei, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Pavetta dalei is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
